meanings.definition: To set up a blockade around (a place or area)
meanings.sent1: The pirates were blockading the harbor to prevent any ships from entering.
meanings.sent2: The military was blockading the border to stop illegal crossings.
meanings.sent3: The kids were blockading the cookie jar, trying to keep their little brother from getting any.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were blockading the entrance to the government building, demanding change.
meanings.sent5: The giant boulder was blockading the narrow path, making it impossible to pass through.

meanings.definition: The action of setting up a blockade around (a place or area)
meanings.sent1: The blockading of the port caused a shortage of supplies in the city.
meanings.sent2: The blockading of the road led to a traffic jam that lasted for hours.
meanings.sent3: The blockading of the fridge by the cat was a clever attempt to get more treats.
meanings.sent4: The blockading of the park entrance by fallen trees made it difficult for visitors to enter.
meanings.sent5: The blockading of the school gate by students protesting against the new rules created chaos in the morning.
